text: Jindřich Kabát (24 April 1953 – 14 July 2020) was a Czech psychologist, professor and politician. He held the office of Czech Minister of Culture from 1992 to 1994. He was also the first Minister of Culture of the Czech Republic. He was born in Prague. Kabát died on 14 July 2020 in Prague, aged 67.First Czech Culture Minister Jindřich Kabát dies aged 67 ==References== Category:Czech politicians Category:Czech psychologists Category:1953 births Category:2020 deaths
title: Jindřich Kabát
